featured.text: Moreover, pieces of junk may collide with each other and break into fragments which fall back to the Earth.
The country has been troubled by a problem with trains colliding with deer on its railways.
Some researchers point out that as trees often grow close together, treetops can easily collide and break when swayed by the wind.

definition.en_def: To come into conflict or crash together with force.
definition.example: The two cars collided at the intersection.
